On Thursday, February 20th, BHS honored Donavan Anderson's school record in the long jump with his nameplate on the track and field school record board.

Last spring, during his sophomore year, Donavan broke the previous long jump record belonging to Weston Daniels. His jump of 21’8 at the Bergen County Championships not only broke a decade-old school record, but also earned him a Bergen County Championship. Donavan would go on to finish 3rd in the North 1, Group 3 Sectional Meet.

This spring, Donavan will look to break his own record in the long jump.

Congratulations, Donavan!

In addition, the school will also receive a Samsung video kit for students to create and submit a three-minute video that showcases their project development and how it addresses the issue. Each year, more than 125,000 students in grades 6-8 enter the VFW’s Patriot’s Pen youth essay contest. The contest encourages young minds to examine America’s history, along with their own experiences in modern American society, by drafting a 300- to 400-word essay expressing their views based on a patriotic theme chosen by the VFW Commander-in-Chief.

The top three essays writers from Roy W. Brown Middle School each won cash prizes. Pictured up front, these finalists were:

1st place: Romy Grau-Gopala
2nd place: Alana De La Cruz
3rd place: Tiffany Gutierrez

Congratulations to the winners and thank you to the Bergenfield VFW Post 6467 and all of our veterans!

BHS senior James Albert Labayna has been named a Commended Student in the 2019 National Merit Scholarship Program. James joins a group of about 34,000 students throughout the nation who are being recognized for their exceptional academic promise.

Commended Students placed among the top scorers of more than 1.6 million students who entered the annual competition by taking the 2017 Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test.

A member of the school’s STEM program, James also competes on the Academic Decathlon, Debate, DECA-Business, Math and Quiz Bowl teams. Additionally, he serves as the Vice President in the school’s chapter of the Science National Honor Society.

James also recently garnered National AP Scholar recognition from College Board. Since entering high school in 2015, James has completed and scored four or higher on 10 AP courses, and is taking another 7 AP courses this year!

Hoover School participated in International Dot Day on Friday, September 14th. The day is a celebration of creativity, courage, and collaboration, inspired by Peter H. Reynolds’ book, The Dot.

The Dot is the story of a caring teacher who dares a doubting student to trust in her own abilities by being brave enough to “make her mark.” What begins with a small dot on a piece of paper becomes a breakthrough in confidence and courage, igniting a journey of self-discovery and sharing, which has gone on to inspire countless children and adults around the globe.

The students and faculty at Hoover each designed their own dots which were then turned into a masterpiece!

Two of Roy W. Brown Middle School's finest scholars, Bianca Del Campo and Juliana Nunez, recently competed in the National History Bee Finals in Atlanta, Georgia.

Each student competed against other regional finalists from all across the United States and advanced to the Championship Round of 256, earning themselves medals.

Their road to success began earlier this year when they participated in the school-wide school competition, securing spots in the Regional Finals by earning qualifying scores. The girls did not disappoint, as they once again excelled and earned qualifying scores to advance to the National Championship!

In the final rankings, Bianca Del Campo ranked 186th in the nation among her grade level while Juliana finished 250th among hers.

Congratulations to both young students on this wonderful accomplishment!

Hoover School art students dominated in the 2017-18 Partnership for a Drug-Free NJ Fourth Grade Poster Contest!

Out of 4,200 entries, only thirty-two students’ posters were selected from across the state as finalists. Of those finalists, five hail from Hoover School--more than any other school in NJ!

Posters featuring the artwork of all 32 finalists will be distributed to fourth grade classrooms across NJ in the fall.

Congratulations to Valentina Vargas Felix, Angelina Villatoro, Luna Palau, Rachael Hurtarte, and Kyle Choonoo for a job well done!
